pages.md:
# Troubleshooting

| Problem                          | Solution                                                                                                                                         |
|----------------------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| **No face is detected.**         | - The subjectâ€™s face is obscured by sunglasses, a hat, long hair, or other objects: Remove the obstructions (ðŸ“– 128).                            |
|                                  | - The subjectâ€™s face occupies only a small area of the frame: Change the composition so that the subjectâ€™s face occupies a larger area of the frame (ðŸ“– 128). |
|                                  | - The subjectâ€™s face is turned away from the camera: Ask the subject to face the camera (ðŸ“– 128).                                                 |
|                                  | - The camera is tilted: Keep the camera level.                                                                                                    |
|                                  | - The subjectâ€™s face is poorly lit: Shoot in bright light.                                                                                        |
| **The flash does not fire.**     | - The flash is disabled: Adjust settings (ðŸ“– 152).                                                                                                |
|                                  | - The battery is exhausted: Charge the battery or insert a fully-charged spare battery (ðŸ“– 36).                                                    |
|                                  | - The camera is in bracketing or continuous mode: Select single frame mode (ðŸ“– 9).                                                                |
| **The flash does not fully light the subject.** | - The subject is not in range of the flash: Position the subject in range of the flash.                                                          |
|                                  | - The flash window is obstructed: Hold the camera correctly.                                                                                     |
|                                  | - Shutter speed is faster than the sync speed: Choose a slower shutter speed (ðŸ“– 99, 102).                                                        |

rows: - The subjectâ€™s face is obscured by sunglasses, a hat, long hair, or other objects: Remove the obstructions (ðŸ“– 128).
- The subjectâ€™s face occupies only a small area of the frame: Change the composition so that the subjectâ€™s face occupies a larger area of the frame (ðŸ“– 128).
- The subjectâ€™s face is turned away from the camera: Ask the subject to face the camera (ðŸ“– 128).
- The camera is tilted: Keep the camera level.
- The subjectâ€™s face is poorly lit: Shoot in bright light.
- The flash is disabled: Adjust settings (ðŸ“– 152).
- The battery is exhausted: Charge the battery or insert a fully-charged spare battery (ðŸ“– 36).
- The camera is in bracketing or continuous mode: Select single frame mode (ðŸ“– 9).
**The flash does not fully light the subject.**
- The subject is not in range of the flash: Position the subject in range of the flash.
- The flash window is obstructed: Hold the camera correctly.
- Shutter speed is faster than the sync speed: Choose a slower shutter speed (ðŸ“– 99, 102).
